content:
Creative Works

    TV

  • Lead writer and on-camera host of four half-hour "supplemental" episodes to the New Literacy TV series, 1984.

    • Books and Web Publications

  • Jacobson, Norman Pair Programming in a Box. National Center for Women & Information Technology (NCWIT), 2009.

  • Typographer and copy editor for Baker, Darrell D. The Encyclopedia of the Egyptian Pharaohs, Volume I: Predynastic to the Twentieth Dynasty (3300-1069 BC). Bannerstone Press, 2008.

  • Crawley, J. Winston, McArthur, William G., & Jacobson, Norman M. Structured Programming Using THINK Pascal on the Macintosh. Prentice Hall, 1992.

  • Jacobson, Norman M. Instructor's Guide to Accompany Structured Programming Using THINK Pascal on the Macintosh Prentice Hall, 1992.

    • Review

  • Review of The Nurnberg Funnel: Designing Minimalist Instruction for Practical Computer Skill. Social Science Computer Review, Winter 1992, 9(4).

    • Reviewed Articles

  • Jacobson, Norman M. and Schaefer, Suzanne. "Pair Programming in CS1: Overcoming Objections to Its Adoption", in inroads (the ACM journal of the Special Interest Group in Computer Science Education--SIGCSE), vol. 40 no. 2 (June 2008).

  • Standish, Thomas A. and Jacobson, Norman. "Using O(n) ProxmapSort and O(1) ProxmapSearch to motivate CS2 students (Part II), inroads, vol. 38 no. 2 (June 2006).

  • Standish, Thomas A. and Jacobson, Norman. "Using O(n) ProxmapSort and O(1) ProxmapSearch to motivate CS2 students (Part I), inroads, vol. 37 no. 4 (December 2005).

  • Jacobson, Norman and Thornton, Alex. "It is time to emphasize arraylists over arrays in Java-based first programming courses," inroads, vol. 35, no. 4 (December 2004).

  • Jacobson, Norman M. "A method for normalizing students' scores when employing multiple graders," inroads, vol. 33, no. 4 (December 2001).

  • Jacobson, Norman. "Using on-computer exams to ensure beginning students' programming competency," inroads vol. 32, no. 4 (December 2000).

    • Invited Presentations

  • "Programming Practices: Pair Programming," UCI Tapestry 2014, July 29-31, 2014.

  • "Pair Programming in a Box," NCWIT Academic Alliance, NCWIT biannual meeting, November 6-7, 2008.

  • "Pair Programming and Collaborative Learning," Broadening Participation in Computing Disciplines (BPCD), Conference on Increasing Success in Information Technology Education (INSITE), October 9-10, 2008.
